contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Kugino'''|久木野村|Kugino-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Aso District, Kumamoto|Aso District]], [[Kumamoto Prefecture|Kumamoto]], [[Japan]]. On February 13, 2005 Kugino was merged the villages of [[Chōyō, Kumamoto|Chōyō]] and [[Hakusui, Kumamoto|Hakusui]], all from [[Aso District, Kumamoto|Aso District]], to form the new village of [[Minamiaso, Kumamoto|Minamiaso]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 2,566 and a [[population density]] of 50.67 persons per km². The total area was 50.64 km². ==External links== * [http://www.minamiaso-v.kumamoto-sgn.jp/ Official website of Minamiaso] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kumamoto Prefecture]] {{coord|32|50|N|131|02|E|region:JP_type:city|display=title}} {{Kumamoto-geo-stub}}
